title: Annotation Processor Simulation
description: Simulate what an annotation processor does by parsing Kotlin source code strings to find annotated elements and generating output code. This demonstrates the concept of compile-time code generation without requiring actual KSP APIs.
instructions: Create an AnnotationProcessor that reads Kotlin source code as a string, finds all classes annotated with @AutoToString, and generates a toString() extension function for each. Parse class names and properties from the source text.

testCases.description: Should detect annotated class and generate toString

hints.text: Look for lines containing @AutoToString, then the next line with 'data class' or 'class'
Extract class name with regex: class (\w+)
Extract constructor parameters between ( and ): val (\w+): (\w+)

commonMistakes.mistake: Trying to use actual KSP or KAPT APIs
commonMistakes.consequence: Dependencies not available in standalone exercise
commonMistakes.correction: This is a simulation using string parsing -- same concept, no framework needed
